title: We are looking for this font to publish a book
content:
![mistery font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080420144626im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38251.jpg)   
   
Here are some sample letters of the font we are looking for; we will appreciate your help.

 [‹ (x) stencil "e" - Helvetica Condensed {Eduardo}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080420144626/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5235 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) typeface in Sony ads - FF Blur (stretched) {Jos ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080420144626/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5250 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: This thread is being moved to the TYPE IDENTIFICATION board.

Reminder: We have tried to find this font throughout the internet, but when we find the M the G is different. The same happens with the W.   
In all of our search we have not been able to locate the whole set with all the letters.   
   
Can somebody please help me in my search?
From where did you get this sample? It looks like a simple receipt. If it is, chances are you won't find anything identical to it.

OCR'ish fonts to check out.   
   
Pure (rodney sheldon fehsenfeld) used to be distributed by Garagefonts   
   
also check out lineto.com
